 Creates a copy of the current interpreter Note that if you pass it a non-null pointer, it will attempt to delete it, if it doesn't point at allocated memory, this will make it seg fault.

Member Function Documentation

bool CommonAspectClass::getLogger (  Logger *&  logger,
bool  printDebug = DO_DEBUG
) 
 

Creates a copy of the current interpreter Note that if you pass it a non-null pointer, it will attempt to delete it, if it doesn't point at allocated memory, this will make it seg fault.

Haven't decided if this is good or bad behavior (it does encourage one to intialize their pointers!)

Parameters:
interpreter a pointer at a copy of this lSystem (the memory is allocated in this method)

Reimplemented in InterpreterInterface.

bool CommonAspectClass::setNotify (  bool  notify,
bool  printDebug = DO_DEBUG
) 
 

Returns (via a reference parameter) a pointer at the logger object for this class Note: this method delets logger if it's passed value is non-NULL.

This means your program may (and hopefully will!) seg fault if you pass a non-initialized, non-null pointer

Parameters:
logger a pointer at the logger object of this class

Reimplemented in InterpreterInterface, and InterpreterInterface.
